title: Honeywell Sales Miss Expectations
text:
By Dave Sebastian and Micah Maidenberg

Honeywell International Inc. reported a lower profit for the third quarter and overall sales that fell a bit lower than what Wall Street analysts predicted.

Honeywell said profit dropped to $1.62 billion, or $2.23 a share, compared with $2.34 billion, or $3.11 a share, in the prior year. Earnings were up 9% after adjustments and exceeded expectations from analysts, according to FactSet.

The industrial conglomerate recorded sales of $9.09 billion for the quarter, down 16% from the comparable quarter last year and following the company's move to spin off businesses. Analysts were expecting $9.12 billion in sales.

The company's sales rose 3% on an organic basis, which excludes currency fluctuations and the effect of deals, and sales in the company's aerospace business rose 10% on the same measure.

The aerospace business, Honeywell's largest unit by sales, generated $3.54 billion in sales for the quarter. The company produces a range of aerospace systems and technology, from electric power systems to engine controls.

The company has previously said that it didn't expect any major impact from the grounding of the Boeing Co.'s 737 MAX plane, which uses some of its products.

Charlotte, N.C.-based Honeywell has moved to slim down in recent years, spinning off its home and transportation businesses into two separate companies.

The company on Thursday nudged down the top end of its sales outlook for 2019, saying it now expects to generate up to $36.9 billion in sales, down from a prior forecast that saw up to $37.2 billion in sales.

Honeywell increased the bottom end of its adjusted-profit forecast. It said it expects to earn at least $8.10 a share on that metric, compared with a prior outlook that foresaw at least $7.95 a share.

In addition to its aerospace products, Honeywell makes rubber boots, industrial-automation products, water-processing systems and other products.

Shares of Honeywell were off 1% in premarket trading.
